senses.sense_definition: In Christian belief, the union of three persons (Father, Son, and Holy Spirit) in one Godhead.

examples.text: The doctrine of the <w>Trinity</w> is central to many Christian denominations.
Art from that period often depicts the <w>Trinity</w> with symbolic imagery.

senses.sense_definition: A female or male given name.

examples.text: My friend <w>Trinity</w> is coming to the party later.
They decided to name their daughter <w>Trinity</w> after the character in the movie.

senses.sense_definition: The code name for the world's first nuclear explosion, conducted by the United States in 1945.

examples.text: The <w>Trinity</w> test marked the beginning of the atomic age.
Scientists gathered in the desert to witness the <w>Trinity</w> explosion.

senses.sense_definition: The name of various towns and cities in countries like Canada and the United States.

examples.text: They visited the small coastal town of <w>Trinity</w> during their summer vacation.
The population of <w>Trinity</w> has grown slightly over the last decade.

senses.sense_definition: A group or set of three people or things considered as a unit.

examples.text: The <w>trinity</w> of mind, body, and spirit is a common theme in wellness.
An unholy <w>trinity</w> of inflation, high interest rates, and unemployment damaged the economy.

senses.sense_definition: The state or quality of being three.

examples.text: The philosopher wrote extensively about the <w>trinity</w> of time: past, present, and future.
There is a certain <w>trinity</w> in the structure of this musical composition.
